main event: A metallic fragment was found in a burned pit in Newark, Ohio on September 13, 1962.
interesting points: The object was analyzed and considered to be related to local topography., No other similar objects were found in the area., The object was assessed to be of little significance., The sample showed unusual readings for surface radioactivity during analysis., The analysis indicated that the sample was likely a water material such as iron-containing slag.
witness description: Robert Harris, residing at 213 South 9th Street, Newark, Ohio
